turns.speaker: TED
turns.text: Yes?

turns.speaker: UNCLE BILLY
turns.text: We've got a huge problem with the magazine, Ted-baby. Our readers hate it. HATE IT. We need to talk.

turns.speaker: UNCLE BILLY
turns.text: I loved my brother. I stood by his wishes to let his son run the company. A son he never knew. A son that he and his wife gave away at birth. A son who was raised in a world quite different from our own. Nevertheless, I was there for the lad. I guided him as best I could. But he's only seventeen, with a mind of his own and judgment that is, well, frankly, not a chip off the old block. There is only one clear solution...  And I think we all know what that is--

turns.speaker: TED
turns.text: --PEACHES! CANNED PEACHES!

turns.speaker: UNCLE BILLY
turns.text: What are you doing?

turns.speaker: TED
turns.text: My job. Back off, Benedict.

turns.speaker: TED
turns.text: Thanks for teaching me an important lesson. What makes a family is love, not blood.

turns.speaker: UNCLE BILLY
turns.text: All is fair in "Heaven," Ted-baby.

turns.speaker: TED
turns.text: That's right. And guess who's the new King of the Unemployment Line.

turns.speaker: UNCLE BILLY
turns.text: Aw, come on, kid. Throw me a bone. I'm your uncle for gosh sakes.

turns.speaker: ZUKERMAN
turns.text: In a hurry, are we?

turns.speaker: TED
turns.text: I was in the middle of a melodramatic exit. It wouldn't really make a statement if I tiptoed out the door...What are you selling?

turns.speaker: ZUKERMAN
turns.text: Bad news.

turns.speaker: TED
turns.text: People pay good money for that?

turns.speaker: ZUKERMAN
turns.text: I'm just a messenger.

turns.speaker: TED
turns.text: Oh no. No way. I've had all the bad news I can take for one day.

turns.speaker: ZUKERMAN
turns.text: It's about your parents.

turns.speaker: TED
turns.text: My parents? What do you mean?

turns.speaker: ZUKERMAN
turns.text: I'm terrible at this. I blurt. I'm a blurter. Your parents...They ...well...they exist no further.  Skinny-dipping. The Amazon. Piranhas. It wasn't pretty.

turns.speaker: TED
turns.text: You've got the wrong guy. The closest my parents have been to the Amazon is the Brazilian pavilion at Epcot.

turns.speaker: ZUKERMAN
turns.text: Well kid, I'm speaking of...your biological parents.

turns.speaker: ZUKERMAN
turns.text: How quaint.

turns.speaker: TED
turns.text: It's spring break. I don't want to go to a will reading.

turns.speaker: ZUKERMAN
turns.text: Are you familiar with "Heaven?"

turns.speaker: TED
turns.text: I'm seventeen. I know it like the back of my hand.

turns.speaker: ZUKERMAN
turns.text: Your fathered owned the entire "Heaven" empire.  You own it now. Any questions?

turns.speaker: ART
turns.text: So, did you set 'em all straight on the ugly facts of life?

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: I have the feeling, they got it down already.  They're a step ahead of us, Artie.

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: Talk to me Artie.

turns.speaker: ART
turns.text: Kelly Van Ryan...

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: ... is accusing me of rape.  Jimmy told me.  Apparently I'm the last to know...

turns.speaker: ART
turns.text: Sam... I...  Sandra Van Ryan's been on the horn with every member of the school board all day long.  She's pushing for suspension...

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: This is insane.

turns.speaker: ART
turns.text: All I can tell you Sam, is hang in there.  They clear you of this mess, you get reinstated, with back pay...

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: That's great.  I'll just tell my creditors I'm not a rapist.  No problem... Shit.  I can't believe the board's going to act without even hearing my side of it.

turns.speaker: ART
turns.text: The Van Ryan family created Blue Bay. They built the school... Sandra Van Ryan calls up the board and says kiss my ass, they say, left, right, or in the middle.  You're gonna need some help on this one, Sam.  You're gonna need a lawyer, and he'd better be a good one.

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: How you doing, Artie?

turns.speaker: ART
turns.text: I... You know... I...

turns.speaker: BARBARA
turns.text: Not that I'm going to be much good after last night...

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: Eat a power bar.

turns.speaker: BARBARA
turns.text: Is that Sandra Van Ryan's kid?

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: Kelly.

turns.speaker: BARBARA
turns.text: She's going to wash your Jeep?

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: Senior class fund-raising gig.  I told 'em they could hose down the Jeep.  Hey, come on.  It's for a good cause.

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: You look pretty.

turns.speaker: BARBARA
turns.text: Thanks.

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: Hey, I've got it, I may as well spend it, right?  I've always wanted to live where I could dive for my dinner.

turns.speaker: BARBARA
turns.text: And where might that be?

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: I was thinking, Antigua, maybe.

turns.speaker: BARBARA
turns.text: I love Antigua.  Maybe I'll come visit you.

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: I'd like that.

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: How soon can we get something?

turns.speaker: DAVE
turns.text: We can get blood type right away. Dental records will take longer.  You want DNA, that can take weeks.

turns.speaker: DAVE
turns.text: Merritt, Forensics.

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: The teeth doin' any talkin'?

turns.speaker: DAVE
turns.text: Ray.  Stop calling.  I told you the dental records will take time...

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: What about the blood?

turns.speaker: DAVE
turns.text: Could be hers.  Types match.  Could be a lot of other people's too...

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: Second you get something on those teeth, I want it

turns.speaker: RUBY
turns.text: Gator can't see what's in front of it for shit.  They see out the sides.  That one don't even know Walter's arm's in his mouth.

turns.speaker: GLORIA
turns.text: What if something distracts it and it snaps anyway?

turns.speaker: RUBY
turns.text: Then I guess Walter can kiss that arm of his goodbye.  He don't use it for no good deeds anyway.

turns.speaker: RUBY
turns.text: You come all the way out here to watch Walter?

turns.speaker: GLORIA
turns.text: I was wondering if I could ask you a few questions.

turns.speaker: RUBY
turns.text: About Suzie?

turns.speaker: GLORIA
turns.text: Actually, I was wondering if I might ask you about Ray Duquette.

turns.speaker: RUBY
turns.text: He used to come around here.  He had a thing going with one of the girls over at the Glades.

turns.speaker: RUBY
turns.text: Got sort of hung up on her, from what hear.

turns.speaker: GLORIA
turns.text: She still work there?

turns.speaker: RUBY
turns.text: No.  Not after that night.  I don't know what happened.  Maybe he caught her with some john... All I know is, the next morning the girl was gone and there was a dead boy... Indian kid named Davy.  Used to live down the road there in a wrecked car. Him and Suzie were at the Glades that night.  It was right after that, Ray got Suzie busted and sent her away.  That's what there is to say about Ray Duquette.

turns.speaker: GLORIA
turns.text: Was there ever any kind of investigation...

turns.speaker: RUBY
turns.text: Wasn't enough Van Ryan had to destroy the people who invested here.  He got to be old, he and his rich cronies would come down here, hunt and whore, act like assholes.  One trip he showed up with this young girl he'd picked up somewhere, gotten her pregnant then dumped her in the swamp.  That came with her.

turns.speaker: GLORIA
turns.text: And the child...

turns.speaker: RUBY
turns.text: She had it, before she drank herself to death.  Wasn't exactly a love child...

turns.speaker: GLORIA
turns.text: Suzie.  Then you're not her grandmother...

turns.speaker: RUBY
turns.text: Raised her like she was, but no, Walter's my only child.  He was a good boy, till the army took him.

turns.speaker: GLORIA
turns.text: So Suzie and Sandra Van Ryan were half- sisters.

turns.speaker: RUBY
turns.text: And the other girl, Kelly.  Suzie's niece.

turns.speaker: RUBY
turns.text: You okay?

turns.speaker: GLORIA
turns.text: I'm fine.  Nice TV.

turns.speaker: GLORIA
turns.text: How are you, Kelly? Would you like to take a break for a minute?

turns.speaker: KELLY
turns.text: I just want to get it over with.  My mom's making me do this. I just want to forget it.

turns.speaker: GLORIA
turns.text: I know you do.

turns.speaker: KELLY
turns.text: The next thing... his hand was in my shorts... you know, from behind.  His fingers... his fingers...

turns.speaker: GLORIA
turns.text: Take your time.

turns.speaker: KELLY
turns.text: They were in me.  Both places... you know.

turns.speaker: GLORIA
turns.text: I understand.

turns.speaker: KELLY
turns.text: He said something like, "Do you want it dirty7" or something.  I tried to turn away, but he pushed me to the floor.

turns.speaker: GLORIA
turns.text: Was there penetration?  Did he put himself inside you?

turns.speaker: KELLY
turns.text: Yes.  I said stop.  I screamed.  I mean that's how it sounded in my head.  He hurt me...

turns.speaker: GLORIA
turns.text: That's okay, Kelly.  You're doing fine.  But I have to ask you something here. When you say it hurt.  Was this the first time a man was inside you?

turns.speaker: KELLY
turns.text: No.  I've done it a couple of times, I mean with guys I dated.  But this hurt... like, he was built... you know...

turns.speaker: GLORIA
turns.text: He was large?

turns.speaker: GLORIA
turns.text: Did you try to fight him?

turns.speaker: KELLY
turns.text: I... he had my wrists pinned behind me. I remember my hands were cold.'

turns.speaker: GLORIA
turns.text: Then what?

turns.speaker: KELLY
turns.text: He kept saying, "Let it happen, let it happen."  Then he just stopped.

turns.speaker: GLORIA
turns.text: You mean he withdrew...

turns.speaker: KELLY
turns.text: Not at first.  He was still inside but he wasn't moving or anything...  He said we had this secret.  And that now he'd be able to help me... because we were close... Something like that.  I don't know.  It's hard to remember, exactly.

turns.speaker: GLORIA
turns.text: Try, Kelly.

turns.speaker: KELLY
turns.text: I know one thing he said.  It was when... when he took himself out and was standing up.  He said, "Don't worry, I didn't come." I can't forget that.  He said, "No little girl can ever make me come."

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: If old pictures interest you, come back some time, there's quite a collection down in the pagoda.  I'll see you get a proper tour.

turns.speaker: GLORIA
turns.text: I'd like that.

turns.speaker: GLORIA
turns.text: And when you turned her toward the door, where did you expect her to go, without a car?

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: Again.  I think we covered this.  I told her I was going to call a cab.

turns.speaker: GLORIA
turns.text: Did you call anyone?  Did you call her house to see if she got home?  Did you call the Masons?

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: No.

turns.speaker: GLORIA
turns.text: Weren't you a little worried about her...?

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: There's a strip mall not half a mile from my house.  There's phones there.  I cruised the place, but I didn't see her. I figured she was probably there but that she was angry and didn't want to be found.  I don't know... Maybe I should have called.  But it's not like Kelly can't take care of herself.  I figured we'd just take it up on Monday, in the office.

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: Isn't that against the law, peeking into windows?

turns.speaker: GLORIA
turns.text: Suzie Toller is missing.

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: How long?

turns.speaker: GLORIA
turns.text: She didn't cone home last night.  We found her car at the bus terminal, but nothing to suggest she bought a ticket.

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: Maybe she used another name.

turns.speaker: GLORIA
turns.text: Ray thinks she was murdered.

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: I don't know what to say...

turns.speaker: GLORIA
turns.text: You could tell me where you were last night.

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: Kelly's file.  Read it.  You're going to find an angry, sexually confused girl who's made threats on her mother's life and a female lover she'd never identify.

turns.speaker: GLORIA
turns.text: Suzie?

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: I've got that two o'clock in town.

turns.speaker: GLORIA
turns.text: Back to the land of grownups.

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: That would make it about the time of her old man's suicide.  You don't think that could explain some erratic behavior?

turns.speaker: GLORIA
turns.text: All I'm saying is, I think we should go slow here.

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: It's our job, Gloria.

turns.speaker: GLORIA
turns.text: Hunter's making it our job because Sandra Van Ryan's got a bug up his ass. You know that as well as I do.  We're gonna trash this guy's life and I keep asking myself if it's really necessary.

turns.speaker: GLORIA
turns.text: Same as him.  They saw her come.  They saw her go.  They saw him follow.

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: Still doesn't explain why he couldn't catch up with her.  I mean how long does it take to put on a shirt?

turns.speaker: GLORIA
turns.text: We failed to mention the mower guy's a drunk, that he was after more beer and never really saw Kelly go into the house, so he can't say how long she was in there.  Same with the kids.  They saw her running down the street, but that's it.  With no physical evidence, what do we have?  Her word against his.

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: You're telling me you believe the guy?

turns.speaker: GLORIA
turns.text: All I'm saying is, we let Sandra Van Ryan push us too hard, we're going to wind up looking stupid.

turns.speaker: GLORIA
turns.text: You can go up to one of those trees and peel the bark.  You know what you get? More bark.  And more bark.  There's no core.  Tree's not good tar anything but sucking up water.  And now they can't get rid of them.  They've tried poisons. Nothing works.  They don't die.

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: Yeah, well, Van Ryan got his.  I don't imagine he gives a shit now.

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: You remember that little girl walked out of our talk at Blue Bay?

turns.speaker: GLORIA
turns.text: The skinny brunette.

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: This is where she lives.  She wants to talk.  Beats the shit out of me why she would call me at all.  I busted her once for possession.  she wound up doing about six months at Camp Nine.

turns.speaker: GLORIA
turns.text: You mean Camp Sixty-Nine.

turns.speaker: GLORIA
turns.text: That's what they called it when I was in Juvenile.  It's a pretty dismal place.

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: It's a shithole.  But she was dirty, what was I gonna do?

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: You saw the news today?

turns.speaker: GLORIA
turns.text: Lombardo's settlement?

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: Think back, before the suit was filed, before the trial.  Lombardo had an affair with Sandra, right?  So why not tell us about the affair?  I mean it could be a hell of a motive for Kelly to fabricate her charge in the first place.

turns.speaker: GLORIA
turns.text: Maybe Lombardo's attorney was saving the affair for the trial.

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: I thought of that.  Then I said, come on, you're Lombardo.  Your reputation is getting trashed.  You want to stop the bleeding.  You don't want to sit in jail for three months.  Unless...

turns.speaker: GLORIA
turns.text: Unless what?

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: Unless you're setting up Sandra Van Ryan for the big payday.

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: They chumped us, Gloria, right from the start.

turns.speaker: GLORIA
turns.text: Why?  You ask me, Lombardo had it pretty good already, nice job in a beautiful setting, popular, an active social life.  He's gonna put this all on the line for some dicey play like what you're describing...

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: The job looks okay to us.  But look at it from his point of view.  The man's surrounded by wealth and privilege.  But for him... it's just a reminder of what should have been his.

turns.speaker: GLORIA
turns.text: So what about the girls?  Suzie's poor, but why would Kelly have to steal from her own mother?  Surely her father...

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: Her father didn't leave her squat.  The kid's got money in trust from her grandfather, but she can't touch that till her mother dies and Sandra seems to have the idea that Kelly ought to learn the value of a buck.

turns.speaker: GLORIA
turns.text: This one's got you working overtime, hasn't it?

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: I flat don't like the guy, Glory.  He's dirty.  And I'll tell you something else.  You want to know how old man Lombardo lost his money?  He was fucked out of it by old man Van Ryan, on a little item known as the Salt Creek Land Deal.  It was after the war.  Van Ryan set up a corporation to develop swamp land, got investors like Lombardo to put up money, then turned around and got the state to declare the area an ecological preserve, on the sly, of course, but everyone knew it was him.  The freeway went to the coast, right where Van Ryan wanted it.

turns.speaker: GLORIA
turns.text: Eliminate the competition.

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: You got it.  The rich got richer.  While the saps like Lombardo went belly-up in the swamp.

turns.speaker: GLORIA
turns.text: Where'd you come up with this stuff, anyway?

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: I net a guy in a bar.

turns.speaker: GLORIA
turns.text: Which she might have saved, if she hadn't set out to destroy the man's life.

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: What?  You wouldn't go after some guy you thought raped your daughter?  Cone on.  She bought the same story we did...

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: Guess I kind of lost it there.

turns.speaker: GLORIA
turns.text: You could say that.

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: Were you ever in a situation where you could see a thing coming and you didn't do what you could to stop it?

turns.speaker: GLORIA
turns.text: We all have...

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: I mean something bad, Gloria, something bad you saw coning, and you didn't do anything, and then it happened.  I did that once.  I don't want to do it again.

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: It's starting, Gloria.  This is how it begins...

turns.speaker: GLORIA
turns.text: Ray.  We don't know anything yet.  She could be anywhere...

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: I'm gonna take you back to the office. Will you put out a call on Suzie's car for me?

turns.speaker: GLORIA
turns.text: You have someplace to be?

turns.speaker: GLORIA
turns.text: If you want company...

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: Just check out the car.

turns.speaker: GLORIA
turns.text: Two kids could've gotten into a fight, lost a couple of teeth.

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: Those are Suzie Toller's teeth.

turns.speaker: GLORIA
turns.text: Where's the body?

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: The swamp, most likely... Lombardo's a swamp rat, knows the body will never be found there.  But he's made a mistake.

turns.speaker: GLORIA
turns.text: Her grandmother said she'd been threatening to run away.  And I found the car at the Miami bus terminal.

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: You don't think Sam could've put it there?

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: Poor dumb Suzie, she never had a chance.

turns.speaker: GLORIA
turns.text: We don't know that, Ray...

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: Will you do me one favor?

turns.speaker: GLORIA
turns.text: Ray, you heard him...

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: What if I'm right, Gloria?  What if I'm right and Hunter's wrong?  What do you do if you see a bad thing coming?

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: Stick with me on this Gloria.  I need you...

turns.speaker: GLORIA
turns.text: And if the teeth aren't Suzie's?  You'll give this up?

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: If I'm wrong about those teeth -- it's a promise.

turns.speaker: GLORIA
turns.text: I'm tired, Ray.  I'm going home.

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: Where's Lombardo?

turns.speaker: GLORIA
turns.text: He's leaving the country.  And I don't give a shit.

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: The blood type on the rocks matches Suzie's.

turns.speaker: GLORIA
turns.text: It's Homicide's job now, Ray, let 'em do it.  I'll tell you something else, there's more to this story than you know, Ray... If Suzie is dead, I think Hunter may be on the right track...

turns.speaker: GLORIA
turns.text: That bothers you?

turns.speaker: SUZIE
turns.text: Yeah, maybe, a little.

turns.speaker: GLORIA
turns.text: Why is that?

turns.speaker: SUZIE
turns.text: You didn't tell me you were gonna put me on the fucking news.

turns.speaker: GLORIA
turns.text: We need to tape the interview, Suzie. No one will see it but us.  Now when was this, that Mr. Lombardo gave you the ride?

turns.speaker: SUZIE
turns.text: About a year ago.

turns.speaker: GLORIA
turns.text: He dropped Jimmy off first?

turns.speaker: SUZIE
turns.text: Yeah.

turns.speaker: GLORIA
turns.text: And when he arrived at your house, was anyone there?

turns.speaker: SUZIE
turns.text: No.

turns.speaker: GLORIA
turns.text: So you were alone.

turns.speaker: SUZIE
turns.text: Yes.

turns.speaker: GLORIA
turns.text: Did he come in with you?

turns.speaker: SUZIE
turns.text: I guess.

turns.speaker: GLORIA
turns.text: At that point were you able to fight him off?

turns.speaker: SUZIE
turns.text: No.  He stopped by himself.  Okay? That's all.  Let me go.

turns.speaker: SUZIE
turns.text: He did say something.

turns.speaker: GLORIA
turns.text: What was that?

turns.speaker: SUZIE
turns.text: He said, "No little bitch can ever make me come."

turns.speaker: HUNTER
turns.text: Why?

turns.speaker: GLORIA
turns.text: I think she's acting.  I think she set it up to be alone with him because she wanted him to come on to her.  I think maybe she's upset that he didn't...

turns.speaker: GLORIA
turns.text: That doesn't make him a child rapist.  There's something else.  This girl's had some problems.  Wrecked a couple of her mom's cars.  Ran away...

turns.speaker: HUNTER
turns.text: Where's this coming from?

turns.speaker: GLORIA
turns.text: I worked Juvenile in Dade County for three years.  We had a missing persons on Kelly Van Ryan for two weeks... Maybe a year ago... The family kept it out of the papers.

turns.speaker: HUNTER
turns.text: I want a full-scale investigation.

turns.speaker: GLORIA
turns.text: You know what that will mean for Lombardo.

turns.speaker: HUNTER
turns.text: I don't care.  You heard that girl's statement.  I think he's dirty.  Get me a case.

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: Or maybe she thought that was what she wanted and she got a little more than she bargained for...

turns.speaker: HUNTER
turns.text: The line I get on this guy, is that he's done half the women in Blue Bay.

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: Not that stuff about her running away, him trying to find her.  That's bullshit.

turns.speaker: HUNTER
turns.text: What about witnesses?

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: We've got three.  Guy mowing his yard, couple of kids playing hoops.

turns.speaker: HUNTER
turns.text: And what do they say?

turns.speaker: HUNTER
turns.text: Are you crazy, Ray?

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: You heard Kelly say "Sam."  That was Lombardo on the phone.  And you saw the girls...

turns.speaker: HUNTER
turns.text: Ray.  The conversation on this tape is totally unintelligible.  What we have here, is you on the Van Ryan property, without a proper warrant, shooting a porn flick...

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: I don't believe I'm hearing this.  A month ago you were pulling these two apart at the courthouse.  They were acting.  They were all acting, from the beginning.  And we bought it, hook, line and sinker... And now they're home free with six million of Sandra Van Ryan's money.

turns.speaker: HUNTER
turns.text: Oh, Ray... no...

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: You think this is just about money, about us looking foolish?  Question him. You're gonna find a stone cold manipulative psychopath.  And those girls are going to wind up dead...

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: Kelly's next, Gloria.

turns.speaker: HUNTER
turns.text: Get off this Ray, now.  If there is any evidence here, it's for Homicide.  You get an ID, you call me.

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: I fucked up.  I lost control of the situation, the one thing they train you for... God, what did I do?

turns.speaker: HUNTER
turns.text: Just tell us what happened.

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: I told Kelly Van Ryan she was under arrest for conspiracy and murder.  I did her rights.

turns.speaker: HUNTER
turns.text: She bit you?

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: Bit, scratched.  But I had her pinned. She calmed down.  I was going to cuff her... She said she thought she was going to be sick.  She asked to use the bathroom.

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: I told her I was coming with her.  She nodded, like she understood.  We stood up together.

turns.speaker: HUNTER
turns.text: You didn't cuff her?

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: She looked shaky, but lucid.  I thought, I would just go with her, stand at the door...  I think I looked away.  A split second. Then, bingo.  Just like that.  She puts a knee into my groin.  There was this coffee table between us and the wall.  She got one foot on that thing and launched herself at the gun case.  Thing had a glass door.  I could hear it breaking.  I didn't go down, but she slowed me up, just enough.  Before I could get to her, she'd turned on me with this small caliber handgun.  I yelled at her to put it down.  She got off a shot.  I took it in the shoulder.  I... I had no choice. I returned fire.  Two rounds, I think. In the chest.

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: The teeth, were they...

turns.speaker: HUNTER
turns.text: Suzie Toller's.  And that's the only thing saving your sorry ass.

turns.speaker: HUNTER
turns.text: You guess?  Did he or didn't he?

turns.speaker: SUZIE
turns.text: Yeah... okay... he did

turns.speaker: HUNTER
turns.text: And then what... he touched you?  Did you maybe flirt a little...

turns.speaker: SUZIE
turns.text: I wanna go home now.

turns.speaker: HUNTER
turns.text: What did you do then?

turns.speaker: SUZIE
turns.text: Shit, what difference does it make... Nobody's gonna believe me anyway...

turns.speaker: HUNTER
turns.text: Suzie!  Did this man rape you?

turns.speaker: SUZIE
turns.text: Okay!  He did.  He pushed me to the floor and he did it to me.  Now, can I go home?

turns.speaker: SUZIE
turns.text: He pushed into me... I couldn't stop him... it hurt.

turns.speaker: HUNTER
turns.text: I'm sorry... you said it hurt?  Why?

turns.speaker: SUZIE
turns.text: Because... it was the biggest I've ever seen.  And I've seen a lot on their way through Jack's Fish Camp.

turns.speaker: HUNTER
turns.text: Ms. Toller?

turns.speaker: SUZIE
turns.text: I said he did.

turns.speaker: HUNTER
turns.text: Ms. Toller.  I'm asking you now, under oath, did Samuel Lonbardo rape you?

turns.speaker: SUZIE
turns.text: This wasn't my idea.

turns.speaker: HUNTER
turns.text: I'm sorry?

turns.speaker: SUZIE
turns.text: He was my friend at first.  Then I got busted... he didn't even stick up for me.  I had to go away to that hellhole. It's like, you're his favorite, then who cares?  You wanna know something?  When Kelly said we should do this, I thought cool, all these big shots screwing me over, like that cop, Duquette.  Now they're gonna get screwed.

turns.speaker: HUNTER
turns.text: Your Honor... Please...

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: Come on.  Beats study hall, doesn't it?

turns.speaker: JIMMY
turns.text: No!

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: Thank you, Jimmy.

turns.speaker: JIMMY
turns.text: Hey, man, at least in study hail I could meditate.

turns.speaker: JIMMY
turns.text: You know, I want to thank you for getting me into this class...  No way was my old man going to spring for the fees...

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: Hey, you're working for it.  Least you're supposed to be.

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: What about you, Jimbo, you need a ride?

turns.speaker: JIMMY
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: A ride.  You want one?

turns.speaker: JIMMY
turns.text: Yeah.  But I got my bike.

turns.speaker: JIMMY
turns.text: It's those rocks, up there.

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: You and Suzie used to come out here together?

turns.speaker: JIMMY
turns.text: Yeah, sometimes.  Lots of the kids hang out here.  You really think something bad happened to Suzie?

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: Lombardo ever come out here?

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: I say something funny?

turns.speaker: JIMMY
turns.text: No.  But I mean... just the idea that Mr. Lombardo would...

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: Way I hear it, he was pretty tight with the kids, one of the guys...

turns.speaker: JIMMY
turns.text: Yeah, but...

turns.speaker: KELLY
turns.text: Will you calm down.  Duquette's gonna come to you just like he did to me. You're gonna have to be ready for him.

turns.speaker: SUZIE
turns.text: Yeah, but he can't push you around like he can me.  You've got family and they've got clout.  With we it's different... with me...

turns.speaker: KELLY
turns.text: Yeah, I've got family and they've got clout and now you have me.  Right?  And Sam.  Believe me, Suzie, this dickhead's not going to send you anywhere.  He's gonna try and rattle your cage, and that's it.  Stay strong and he can't do shit.

turns.speaker: SUZIE
turns.text: Man, I wanna smoke a joint.

turns.speaker: KELLY
turns.text: I can't believe you called Sam.  What's the matter with you?

turns.speaker: SUZIE
turns.text: I'm scared, that's what.  I'm scared there's no one to trust.

turns.speaker: KELLY
turns.text: You can trust me.

turns.speaker: SUZIE
turns.text: You're gonna fuck me over, aren't you?

turns.speaker: KELLY
turns.text: Oh, for Christ's sake.

turns.speaker: SUZIE
turns.text: You are.

turns.speaker: KELLY
turns.text: Are you retarded, or just brain dead from whiffin' fumes out there in the swamp...

turns.speaker: KELLY
turns.text: Anybody ever tell you that stuff will rot your brain?

turns.speaker: SUZIE
turns.text: What brain?

turns.speaker: SUZIE
turns.text: What are you looking at?

turns.speaker: KELLY
turns.text: Nothing.

turns.speaker: SUZIE
turns.text: I thought we were goin' to a movie.

turns.speaker: KELLY
turns.text: I think we just need to get wasted.

turns.speaker: SUZIE
turns.text: I wanna live at the beach someday.

turns.speaker: KELLY
turns.text: Shit.

turns.speaker: KELLY
turns.text: Is there some reason why you're here?

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: Curiosity, I guess.

turns.speaker: KELLY
turns.text: About what?  How to improve your breast stroke?

turns.speaker: KELLY
turns.text: Excuse me?

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: You all gonna go down to the Caribbean together?

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: The thing about it is, threesomes so rarely work out.

turns.speaker: KELLY
turns.text: You're out of your mind.

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: I've been a cop for a while, Kelly.  It's hard enough for one person to keep a secret, let alone three.  And then there's the love angle.  I mean do you and Sam really want that little pill-head around, now that you have the money?
